Question: The average score in Mathematics of 90 students of sections A and B of class IX was 63. The number of students in A were 10 more than those in B. The average score of students in A was 30% more than that of students in B. The average score of students in B is:
Solution:
Given:
Number of students = 90
Students in A = Students in B + 10
Average of the score in Mathematics of students in A and B = 63
Average of students in section A = 130% of students in section B.
Concept used:
Average = sum of elements/number of elements
Calculation:
Let the students in section B be ‘x’
Students in section A = x + 10
⇒ (Sum of the score of students)/number of the students = 63
⇒ Sum of the score of students = 90 × 63
⇒ Sum of the score of students = 5670
Number of the students = 90
⇒ x + x + 10 = 90
⇒ x = 40
Students in Section B = 40
Students in section A = 40 + 10 = 50
Let the average be ‘p’.
Average of students in section A = 130% of students in section B
⇒ (Average of students in section A/Average of students in section B) = 13p/10p
⇒ 13p × 50 + 10p × 40 = 5670
⇒ 650p + 400p = 5670
⇒ 1050p = 5670
⇒ p = 5.4
Average of students in section B = 10p
⇒ 5.4 × 10
⇒ 54
∴ The average score of students in B is 54.

Question: The curved surface area of a right cylinder is 3696 cm<sup>2</sup>. Its height is three times its radius. What is the capacity (in litres) of the cylinder? (take π =\(\frac{22}{7}\))
Solution:
Given:
The curved surface area of the right cylinder = 3696 cm2
Height of cylinder = 3 × radius of the cylinder
Formula used:
The curved surface area of cylinder = 2πrh
Volume of cylinder = πr2h
Where,
r = radius of cylinder
h = height of cylinder
Concept used:
1 cm3 = 0.001 litre
Calculation:
Let the radius of the cylinder be ‘r’ and the height of the cylinder be ‘h’.
Curved surface area of cylinder = 2πrh

⇒ 2πrh = 3696
⇒ 2πr × 3r = 3696 (h = 3r)
⇒ r2 = (3696 × 7)/(22 × 6)
⇒ r2 = 196
⇒ r = 14 cm
⇒ h = 3r = 3 × 14 = 42 cm
Volume of cylinder = πr2h
⇒ (22/7) × 14 × 14 × 42
⇒ 25872 cm3
We know, 1 cm3 = 0.001 litre
⇒ 25872 × 0.001
⇒ 25.872 litres
∴ The volume of the cylinder is 25.872 litres.

Question: The sides BA and DE of a regular pentagon are produced to meet at F. What is a measure of ∠EFA?
Solution:
Given:
Sides of pentagon BA and DE extended to meet at F.
Concept used:
Sum of interior angles of a regular pentagon is 540°.
Each interior angle = 180(n – 2)/n
Where, n = number of sides
Sum of all angles in a triangle is 180°.
Sum of angles of a straight line is 180°.
Calculation:

BA extended up to F.
DE extended up to F.
Each interior angle of the pentagon = 180(5 – 2)/5
Each interior angle of the pentagon = 108°
Each angle of a regular pentagon is 108°.
BF forms a straight line.
⇒ ∠BAE + ∠EAF = 180°
⇒ ∠EAF = 180° - 108°
⇒ ∠EAF = 72°
DF forms a straight line.
⇒ ∠DEA + ∠AEF = 180°
⇒ ∠AEF = 180° - 108°
⇒ ∠AEF = 72°
In ΔAEF
⇒ ∠AEF + ∠EAF + ∠EFA = 180°
⇒ ∠EFA = 180° - 72° - 72°
⇒ ∠EFA = 36°
∴ The value of ∠EFA is 36°.

Question: The expression \(\frac{{15\left( {\sqrt {10} + \sqrt 5 } \right)}}{{\sqrt {10\;} + \sqrt {20} + \sqrt {40} - \sqrt 5 - \sqrt {80} }}\) is equal to:
A person has to cover a distance of 150 km in 15 hours. If he traveled with the speed of 11.8 km/hr for 10 hours. At what speed he has to travel to cover the remaining distance in the remaining time?
Solution:
Given:
Total distance = 150 km
Total time is taken = 15 hours
Formula used:
Speed = Distance/Time
Calculation:
For starting 10 hours travelled with 11.8 km/hr.
Distance = Speed × Time
⇒ 11.8 × 10
⇒ 118 km
Remaining distance
⇒ 150 – 118 = 32 km
Remaining Time
⇒ 15 – 10 = 5 hours
Speed to travel 32 km in 5 hours
⇒ 32/5
⇒ 6.4 km/hr
∴ Speed to travel remaining distance is 6.4 km/hr.

Question: The height of a solid cylinder is 30 cm and the diameter of its base is 10 cm. Two identical conical holes each of radius 5 cm and height 12 cm are drilled out. What is the surface area (in cm<sup>2</sup>) of the remaining solid?
Solution:
Given:
Height of cylinder = 30 cm
Radius of cylinder = 5 cm
Height of cone = 12 cm
Radius of cone = 5 cm
Formula used:
The surface area of cylinder = 2πrh
The surface area of cone = πrl
l2 = h2 + r2
Where,
l = slant height of the cone
h = height
r = radius
Calculation:

l2 = h2 + r2
⇒ l2 = 122 + 52
⇒ l2 = 144 + 25
⇒ l = 13 cm
The surface area of the remaining figure = surface area of cylinder + 2 × Curved surface area of the cone
⇒ 2πrh + 2πrl
⇒ 2πr(h + l)
⇒ 2π × 5(30 + 13)
⇒ 430π
∴ The surface area of the remaining solid is 430π.
Additional Information
When the cones are drilled out then the volume of a cylinder is decreasing. But the surface area will increase. Surface area means the area which we can touch. When the cones drilled out then we can touch both outer and the inner surface. So we have to add both surface areas.

Question: If 9x<sup>2</sup> + y<sup>2</sup> = 37 and xy = 2, x, y > 0, then the value of (27x<sup>3</sup> + y<sup>3</sup>) is:
Solution:
Given:
9x2 + y2 = 37 and xy = 2
Formula used:
(x + y)2 = x2 + y2 + 2xy
(x + y)3 = x3 + y3 + 3x2y + 3xy2
Calculation:
(3x + y)2 = 9x2 + y2 + 6xy
⇒ (3x + y)2= 37 + 6 × 2
⇒ (3x + y)2= 37 + 12
⇒ (3x + y)2= 49
⇒ (3x + y) = 7
(3x + y)3 = 27x3 + y3 + 27x2y + 9xy2
⇒ 73 = 27x3 + y3 + 27x2y + 9xy2
⇒ 343 = 27x3 + y3 + 9xy(3x + y)
⇒ 343 = 27x3 + y3 + 9 × 2 × 7
⇒ 27x3 + y3 = 343 – 126
⇒ 27x3 + y3 = 217
∴ The value of 27x3 + y3 is 217

Question: The value of \(\frac{{\rm cose{c^2}30^\circ {{\rm \sin }^2}45^\circ + {{\rm \sec }^2}60^\circ }}{{\rm tan60^\circ \rm cose{c^2}45^\circ - {{\rm \sec }^2}60^\circ \rm tan45^\circ }}\) is:
Solution:
Given:
(cosec230°sin245° + sec260°)/(tan60°cosec245° - sec260°tan45°)
Concept used:
0°30°45°60°90°
sin01/21/√2√3/21
cos1√3/21/√21/20
tan01/√31√3∞
cosec∞2√22/√31
sec12/√3√22∞
cot∞√311/√30
Calculation:
(cosec230°sin245° + sec260°)/(tan60°cosec245° - sec260°tan45°)
⇒ (4 × 1/2 + 4)/(√3 × 2 – 4 × 1)
⇒ 6/(2√3 – 4)
⇒ 3/(√3 – 2)
Rationalise above value
⇒ 3/(√3 - 2)
⇒ - 3/(2 - √3) × (2 + √3)/(2 + √3)
⇒ -3(2 + √3)/{4 - 3} = -3(2 + √3)
∴ The value is -3(2 + √3).

Question: Given that ΔDEF ~ ΔABC. If the area of ΔABC is 9 cm<sup>2</sup> and area of ΔDEF is 12cm<sup>2</sup> , BC = 2.1 cm, then the length of EF is:
Solution:
Given :-
ΔDEF ~ ΔABC
Area of ΔABC is 9 cm2 and ΔDEF is 12 cm2
BC = 2.1 cm
Concept :-
Relation among areas, side, altitude and perimeters of similar triangle
(area of ΔABC/area of ΔDEF) = (AB/DE)2 = (BC/EF)2 = (AC/DF)2
Calculation :-
Let EF = x cm
⇒ (9/12) = (2.1/x)2
⇒ x2 = (2.1 × 2.1× 12)/9
⇒ x2 = (7 × 7 × 3)/25
⇒ x = √((7 × 7 × 3)/25)
⇒ x = (7√3)/5
⇒ EF = (7√3)/5 cm
∴ EF is (7√3)/5 cm

Question: If a + b + c = 6, a<sup>3</sup> + b<sup>3</sup> + c<sup>3</sup> - 3 abc = 342,and a<sup>2</sup> + b<sup>2</sup> + c<sup>2</sup> = 50, then what is the value of ab + bc + ca?
Solution:
Given :-
If a + b + c = 6, a3 + b3 + c3 - 3abc = 342, and a2 + b2 + c2 = 50
Concept :-
a3 + b3 + c3 - 3abc = (a + b + c) (a2 + b2 + c2 - ab - bc -ca)
Calculation :-
a3 + b3 + c3 - 3abc = (a + b + c) (a2 + b2 + c2 - ab - bc -ca)
⇒ 342 = 6 × (50 - ab - bc - ca)
⇒ (342/6) = 50 - (ab + bc + ca)
⇒ 57 = 50 - (ab + bc + ca)
⇒ (ab + bc + ca) = 50 - 57
⇒ (ab + bc + ca) = -7
∴ (ab + bc + ca) is -7

Question: If 3x<sup>2</sup> - 5x + 1 = 0, then the value of \((x^2+\frac{1}{9x^2})\) is:
Solution:
Given :-
3x2 - 5x + 1 = 0
Concept :-
(a + b)2 = a2 + b2 + 2ab
Calculation :-
3x2 - 5x + 1 = 0
First divide both side by x
⇒ (3x2 - 5x + 1)/x = 0/x
⇒ (3x2/x) - (5x/x) + (1/x) = 0
⇒ 3x - 5 + (1/x) = 0
⇒ 3x + (1/x) = 5
Now, again divide both side by 3
⇒ (3x/3) + ((1/x)/3) = (5/3)
⇒ x + (1/3x) = (5/3)
Now, Squaring both side
⇒ (x + (1/3x))2 = (5/3)2
⇒ x2 + (1/3x)2 + (2 × x × (1/3x)) = (25/9)
⇒ x2 + (1/9x2) + (2/3) = (25/9)
⇒ x2 + (1/9x2) = (25/9) - (2/3)
⇒ x2 + (1/9x2) = (25 - 6)/9
⇒ x2 + (1/9x2) = (19/9)
∴ x2 + (1/9x2) is (19/9)

Question: A spherical metallic shell with 6 cm external radius mass 6688 g. What is the thickness of the shell if the density of metal is 10.5 g per cm3 ?
Solution:
Given :-
External radius of spherical metallic shell = 6 cm
Weight of metallic shell = 6688 g
Density = 10.5 g/cm3
Concept :-
If mass and density is given then,
Volume = (Mass/Density)
If thickness is given then,
Volume of sphere = (4/3)π(R3 - r3)
Where,
R = External radius
r = Inner radius
Thickness of sphere = (R - r)
Calculation :-

⇒ Volume = (6688/10.5)
Now,
⇒ (6688/10.5) = (4/3) × (22/7) × (63 - r3)
⇒ (63 - r3) = (6688 × 3 × 7)/(22 × 4 × 10.5)
⇒ (63 - r3) = 152
⇒ 216 - r3 = 152
⇒ r3 = 216 - 152
⇒ r3 = 64
⇒ r = ∛64
⇒ r = 4
Now,
⇒ Thickness = 6 - 4 = 2 cm
∴ Thickness of the shell 2 cm

Question: Two positive numbers differ by 1280. When the greater number is divided by the smaller number, the quotient is 7 and the remainder is 50. The greater number is:
Solution:
Given :-
Two positive numbers differ by 1280
When the greater number is divided by the smaller number
The quotient is 7 and the remainder is 50
Concept :-
Dividend = Quotient × divisor + remainder
Calculation :-
Let greater number = a and
Smaller number = b
From question,
⇒ a - b = 1280 ....(1)
Again from question,
⇒ a = 7b + 50 ....(2)
Put the value of a from equation (2) into equation (1)
⇒ 7b + 50 - b = 1280
⇒ 6b = 1280 - 50
⇒ 6b = 1230
⇒ b = (1230/6)
⇒ b = 205
Put the value of b in equation (1)
⇒ a - 205 = 1280
⇒ a = 1280 + 205
⇒ a = 1485
⇒ Greater number = 1485
∴ Greater number is 1485

Question: A can do a piece of work in 15 days. B is 25% more efficient than A and C is 40% more efficient than B. A and C work together for 3 days and then C leaves. A and B together will complete the remaining work in:
Solution:
Given :-
A can do a piece of work in 15 days
B is 25% more efficient than A and
C is 40% more efficient than B
Concept :-
Ratio of efficiency is reciprocal of time.
Number of days required to complete a certain work = (Work to be completed/Work efficiency)
Calculation :-
Let efficiency of A be 100
⇒ Efficiency of B = 100 + (100 × 25%)
⇒ Efficiency of B = 100 + 25 = 125
⇒ Efficiency of C = 125 + (125 × 40%)
⇒ Efficiency of C = 125 + 50 = 175
⇒ Ratio of efficiency of A ∶ B ∶ C = 100 ∶ 125 ∶ 175
⇒ Ratio of efficiency of A ∶ B ∶ C = 4 ∶ 5 ∶ 7
A work for 15 days with efficiency 4
⇒ Total work done by A = 15 × 4 = 60 unit
Now,
(A + C) together work for 3 days.
⇒ Total efficiency of A and C together = 4 + 7 = 11 unit/day
⇒ Total work done by A and C together = 11 × 3 = 33 unit
⇒ Remaining work = Total work - Work done by A and C together
⇒ Remaining work = 60 - 33
⇒ Remaining work = 27 unit
⇒ Total efficiency of A and B together = 4 + 5 = 9 unit/day
⇒ Required number of days = (27/9) = 3 days
⇒ Time required to complete remaining work = 3 days.
∴ Time required to complete remaining work is 3 days.

Question: The base of a right prism is a regular hexagon of a side 5 cm. If its height is 12√3 cm, then its volume (in cm<sup>3</sup>) is:
Solution:
Given :-
The base of a right prism is a regular hexagon of side 5 cm
height is 12 √3 cm
Concept :-
Prism is a part of cylinder so,
Volume of prism = Base × Height
As base of prism is shan so
Volume of prism with base hexagonal = base area × height
Base area = Area of hexagonal is equal to area of 6 equilateral triangle = 6 × (√3/4) × side2
Calculation :-

⇒ Base area = 6 × (√3/4) × 52
⇒ Base area = 150 × (√3/4)
⇒ Volume = 150 × (√3/4) × 12√3
⇒ Volume = (1800 × 3)/4
⇒ Volume = 1350 cm3
∴ Volume = 1350 cm3

Question: The area of the base of a right circular cone is 81π cm<sup>2</sup> and its height is 12 cm. What is the curved surface area (in cm<sup>2</sup>) of the cone?
Solution:
Given:
The area of the base of a right circular cone is 81π cm2 and its height is 12 cm.
Concept Used:
If r be the radius of the base of a cone and h be the height of the cone then the area of the base is πr2 and slant height of the cone (l) = \({ \sqrt{r^2 + h^2} }\)
The curved surface area of the cone is πrl
Calculation:

The area of the base of a right circular cone is 81π cm2
πr2 = 81π
⇒ r2 = 81
⇒ r = 9
The height of the cone is 12 cm
The slant height of the cone (l) is
AC = \({ \sqrt{9^2 + 12^2} }\)
⇒ AC = 15
The curved surface area of the cone is π × 9 × 15
⇒ 135π
∴ The curved surface area of the cone is 135π cm2

Question: The value of \(\frac{{2{{\sin }^2}38^\circ {{\sec }^2}52^\circ + \rm cos64^\circ \;sin26^\circ + {{\sin }^2}64^\circ }}{{{{\tan }^2}23^\circ + {{\cot }^2}23^\circ - {{\sec }^2}67^\circ - \rm cose{c^2}67^\circ }}\) is:
Solution:
Given:
\(\frac{{2{{\sin }^2}38^\circ {{\sec }^2}52^\circ + \rm cos64^\circ \;sin26^\circ + {{\sin }^2}64^\circ }}{{{{\tan }^2}23^\circ + {{\cot }^2}23^\circ - {{\sec }^2}67^\circ - \rm cose{c^2}67^\circ }}\)
Concept Used:
sin(90° - θ) = cosθ
tan(90° - θ) = cotθ
cot(90° - θ) = tanθ
sin2θ + cos2θ = 1
cosec2θ - cot2θ = 1
sec2θ - tan2θ = 1
Calculation:
\(\frac{{2{{\sin }^2}38^\circ {{\sec }^2}52^\circ + \rm cos64^\circ \;sin26^\circ + {{\sin }^2}64^\circ }}{{{{\tan }^2}23^\circ + {{\cot }^2}23^\circ - {{\sec }^2}67^\circ - \rm cose{c^2}67^\circ }}\)
⇒ {2sin2(90° - 52°)sec252° + cos64° sin(90° - 64°) + sin264°}/{tan2(90° - 67°) - cosec267° + cot2(90° - 67°) - sec267°}
⇒ {2cos252° sec252° + cos64° cos64° + sin264°}/{cot267° - cosec267° + tan267° - sec267°}
⇒ {2 + (cos264° + sin264°)}/{ - (cosec267° - cot267°) - (sec267° - tan267°)}
⇒ (2 + 1)/(-1 - 1)
⇒ -3/2
∴ The required value is (-3/2)

Question:
Study the given graph and answer the question that follows.

The total revenue in 2015 and 2017 is what per cent of the total expenditure of the company in 2016, 2018 and 2019 (correct to one decimal place?
Solution:
Given:
The revenue in 2015 and 2017 is 210 crores and 240 crores respectively
The expenditure of the company in 2016, 2018 and 2019 is 175 crores, 165 crores and 170 crores respectively
Concept Used:
Concept of percentage. It is calculated on the base of 100
For Example, x% means x out of 100
Calculation:
The total revenue in 2015 and 2017 is (210 + 240) crores
⇒ 450 crores
The total expenditure of the company in 2016, 2018 and 2019 is (175 + 165 + 170) crores
⇒ 510 crores
The required percentage is {(450/510) × 100}%
⇒ 88.23%
∴ The total revenue in 2015 and 2017 is 88.2% of the total expenditure of the company in 2016, 2018 and 2019 (correct to one decimal place)

Question: In ΔABC, ∠C = 90°, Point P and Q are on the sides AC and BC, respectively, such that AP : PC = BQ : QC = 1 : 2 then, \(\frac{AQ^2+BP^2}{AB^2}\) is equal to:
Solution:
Given:
In ΔABC, ∠C = 90°, Point P and Q are on the sides AC and BC, respectively, such that AP : PC = BQ : QC = 1 : 2
Concept Used:
Let ΔABC be a right angle triangle at C and BC and AC are two adjacent sides to the right angle of the triangle. If P and Q are two points on the side AC and BC respectively divides the line in the same ratio then, BP2 + AQ2 = PQ2 + AB2
Calculation:

Point P and Q are on the sides AC and BC, respectively, such that AP : PC = BQ : QC = 1 : 2
P and Q divides AC and BC in the same ratio respectively
AQ2 + BP2 = PQ2 + AB2
In ΔCAQ, CA2 + CQ2 = AQ2
AQ2 = (3x)2 + (2x)2 [ x is a constant]
⇒ AQ2 = 13x2
Similerly in Triangle BCP
⇒ BP2 = 13x2
In ΔABC, AC2 + BC2 = AB2
⇒ AB2 = (3x)2 + (3x)2
⇒ AB2 = 18x2
This shows that AQ2 + BP2 = 13x2 + 13x2
⇒ 26x2
\(\frac{AQ^2+BP^2}{AB^2}\) = 26x2/18x2
⇒ 13/9
∴ \(\frac{AQ^2+BP^2}{AB^2}\) = 13/9

Question: The marked price of an article is 40% above its cost price. If its selling price is \(73 \frac{1}{2}\%\) of the marked price, then the profit percentage is:
Solution:
Given:
The marked price of an article is 40% above its cost price. Its selling price is \(73 \frac{1}{2}\%\) of the marked price.
Concept Used:
Profit = Selling price - Cost price
Calculation:
Let, the Cost price of the article be 100
Then marked price of the article is (100 + 40) = 140
Selling price is \(73 \frac{1}{2}\%\) of the marked price
⇒ 147/2 % of the marked price
Selling price is {140 × (147/2)}/100
⇒ (140 × 147)/200
⇒ 102.9
Profit = (102.9 - 100)
⇒ 2.9
Profit percentage is (2.9 × 100)/100
⇒ 2.9%
∴ The profit percentage is 2.9%.

Question: ABCD is a cyclic quadrilateral. Diagonals BD and AC intersect each other at E. If ∠BEC = 128° and ∠ECD = 25°, then what is the measure of ∠BAC?
Solution:
Given:
ABCD is a cyclic quadrilateral. Diagonals BD and AC intersect each other at E. If ∠BEC = 128° and ∠ECD = 25°
Concept Used:
In cyclic quadrilateral angles on the same arc are always same.
Calculation:

∠BEC and ∠CED are on the same straight line
∠BEC = 128°
∠CED = 180° - 128°
⇒ ∠CED = 52°
In ΔCDE, ∠CED = 52° and ∠DCE = 25°
∠CDE = 180° - (52° + 25°)
⇒ ∠CDE = 103°
∠BAC and ∠BDC are on the same arc BC
We know that In cyclic quadrilateral angles on the same arc are always same.
∠BAC = 103°
∴ Then measure of ∠BAC is 103°

Question: A certain sum amounts to Rs. 15,500 in 2 years at 12% p.a. simple interest. If the same sum is compounded half-yearly at 10% per annum for \(1 \frac{1}{2}\) years, what will be the amount received?
Solution:
Given:
A certain sum amounts to Rs. 15,500 in 2 years at 12% p.a. simple interest. Next time is 1.5 year and the rate of interest is 10% p.a. and interest compounded half yearly.
Concept Used:
Interest = Principal - amount
If p be the principal and the rate of interest is r then simple interest in t year is ptr/100
If p be the principal, r be the rate of interest, the interest compounded half yearly then amount after t year will be p(1 + r/200)2t
Calculation:
Let the principal be p
Simple interest get in 2 years at 12% p.a. simple interest is (2 × 12p)/100
⇒ 24p/100
Amount = 24p/100 + p
⇒ 124p/100
Accordingly,
124p/100 = 15500
⇒ p = 12500
The principal is 12500
Total time is 1.5 year
The rate of interest is 10% p.a.
Interest compounded half yearly
Rate = 5%
Time = 3 Year
Amount after 1.5 years will be 12500 × (1 + 5/100)1.5 × 2
⇒ 12500 × (21/20)3
⇒ 14470.31
⇒ 14470
∴ The amount will be 14470 after 1.5 year

Question: A and B start moving towards each other from places X and Y, respectively, at the same time on the same day. The speed of A is 20% more than that of B. After meeting on the way, A and B take p hours and \(7\frac{1}{5}\)hours, respectively, to reach Y and X, respectively. What is the value of p?
Solution:
Shortcut Trick S1/S2 = √(t2/t1)
given
S1 = 120% of S2
Let
S2 = 5x
then
S1= 6x
given
t2 = 7(1/5) = 36/5
t1 = p
so,
6x/5x = √(36/5)/p
so
36/25 = 36/5p
p = 5

Given:
A and B start moving towards each other from places X and Y, respectively, at the same time on the same day. The speed of A is 20% more than that of B. After meeting on the way, A and B take p hours and \(7\frac{1}{5}\)hours, respectively
Concept Used:
Time taken = Distance covered / Speed
Calculation:
Let, speed of B be 10v km/h
Speed of a is 12v km/h
Let the distance be d
Time taken to cover the whole distance by A is (d/12v) hours
Time taken to cover the whole distance by B is (d/10v) hours
Relative speed (10v + 12V)
⇒ 22v km/h
When they meet each other together they covered d distance
Time taken to meet d/22v hours
Then time taken by A to cover the whole journey is (d/22v + P) hours
d/22v + p = d/12v
⇒ p = d/12v - d/22v
⇒ p = (d/v)(1/12 - 1/22)
⇒ p = 5/132.(d/v)
⇒ d/v = 132p/5 ----(1)
Time taken by B to cover the whole journey is (d/22v + \(7\frac{1}{5}\)) = (d/22v + 36/5)
d/22v + 36/5 = d/10v
⇒ 36/5 = d/10v - d/22v
⇒ 36/5 = (d/v).(1/10 - 1/22)
⇒ 36/5 = (6/110).(d/v)
⇒ d/v = 6 × 22 ----(2)
From (1) and (2) get,
132p/5 = 6 × 22
⇒ p = 5
∴ The value of p is 5
Alternate Method

Let speed of A and B be 6x and 5x respectively
First case
When they meet at O, both time is the same
⇒ D1 = S1t, D2 = S2t
⇒ D1 = 5xt ----(1)
⇒ D2 = 6xt ----(2)
According to the question after meeting reach final destination B and A take 7(1/5)hr and P hr
Then,
D1 = 5xt
⇒ D1= 5x × (36/5)
⇒ D1= 36 x ----(3)
Put equation 3 in equation 1
⇒ 36 x = 6xt
⇒ t = 6 ----(4)
D2 = 6xt
A takes P hour
D2 = 6xp ----(5)
Put equation 5 in equation 2
⇒ 5xt = 6xp (Put t = 6)
⇒ p = 30/6 = 5 hours
∴ The value of p is 5

Question: If \(sec\theta = \frac{a}{b},b \ne 0,then\frac{{1 - {{\tan }^2}\theta }}{{2 - {{\sin }^2}\theta }}\)=?
Solution:
Given-
secθ = \(a\over b\)
Formula used:
Using the Pythagorean theorem,
h = \(\sqrt{p^2 + b^2}\)
tanθ = \(p\over b\), (Perpendicular / Base)
sinθ =\(p\over h\), (Perpendicular / hypotenuse)
Calculation-
According to Question -
secθ = \(a\over b\), (Hypotenuse / Base)
p = = \(\sqrt{h^2 - b^2}\) = \(\sqrt{a^2 - b^2}\)
tan2θ = (a2 - b2) / b2
sin2θ = (a2 - b2) / a2
(1 - tan2θ)/(2 - sin2θ)
⇒ {(2b2 - a2) / b2} / {(a2 + b2) / a2}
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{{a^2}\left( {2{b^2} - {a^2}} \right)}}{{{b^2}\left( {{a^2} + {b^2}} \right)}}\)
∴\(\frac{{1 - {{\tan }^2}θ }}{{2 - {{\sin }^2}θ }}=\frac{{{a^2}\left( {2{b^2} - {a^2}} \right)}}{{{b^2}\left( {{a^2} + {b^2}} \right)}}\)

Question: If sin3A = cos(30° - A), where A is an acute angle, then what is the value of 2cosecA + tan<sup>2</sup>2A - cot<sup>2</sup>A
Solution:
Given-
sin3A = cos(30° - A)
Concept Used-
If sinA = cosB, then A and B are complementary angles i.e A + B = 90°
Important trigonometric values

Calculation-
sin3A = cos(30° - A)
⇒ 3A + 30 - A = 90°
⇒ A = 30°
Now, 2cosecA + tan22A - cot2A
⇒ 2cosec30° + tan22 × 30° - cot230°
⇒ 2cosec30° + tan260° - cot230°
⇒ 2 × 2 + √32 - √32
⇒ 4
∴ The value of 2cosecA + tan22A - cot2A is 4.

Question: When x is added to each of 9, 15, 21 and 31, the numbers so obtained are in proportion. What is the mean proportional between the numbers (3x - 2) and (5x + 4)?
Solution:
Given-
When x is added to each of 9, 15, 21 and 31, the numbers so obtained are in proportion.
Concept Used-
If a, b, c and d are in proportion, then a/b = c/d
Mean proportion of two numbers a and b is √ab
Calculation-
According to Question-
(9 + x)/(15 + x) = (21 + x)/(31 + x)
⇒ (9 + x)(31 + x) = (15 + x)(21 + x)
⇒ x2 + 40x + 279 = x2 + 36x + 315
⇒ 4x = 36
⇒ x = 9
Mean proportion of (3x - 2) and (5x + 4) = √{(3×9 - 2)(5×9 + 4)}
⇒ √(25 × 49)
⇒ 35
∴ Mean proportional between the numbers (3x - 2) and (5x + 4) is 35.

Question: In ΔPQR, ∠Q = 90°. If cot R=\(\frac{1}{3},\) then what is the value of \(\frac{secP(cosR+sinP)}{cosecR(sinR-cosec P)}\)?
Solution:
Given-
cot R = \(\frac{1}{3}\)
Concept Used-
secθ = H/B, cosecθ = H/P, sinθ = P/H, cosθ = B/H, cotθ = B/P and H2= P2 + B2 [where H = hypotenuse, B = base and P = perpendicular]
Calculation-

cotR = 1/3
P = 3, B = 1, H = √10
secP = √10/3, cosR = 1/√10, sinP = 1/√10, cosecR = √ 10/3, sinR = 3/√10, cosecP = √10/1
Now, \(\frac{secP(cosR+sinP)}{cosecR(sinR-cosec P)}\)
\(⇒ \frac{{\frac{{√ {10} }}{3}\left( {\frac{1}{{√ {10} }} + \frac{1}{{√ {10} }}} \right)}}{{\frac{{√ {10} }}{3}\left( {\frac{3}{{√ {10} }} - √ {10} } \right)}}\)
⇒ (2/√10)/(-7/√10)
⇒ -2/7
The value of \(\frac{secP(cosR+sinP)}{cosecR(sinR-cosec P)}\) = -2/7

Question: Amit, after giving a 12% discount on the marked price, sells an article for Rs. 369.60. If he had not given any discount he would have gained 20%. Find the cost price of the item.
Solution:
Given:
After giving 12% discount on the marked price, the selling price of the article is 369.60
Concept Used:
Marked Price (MP) / Cost Price (CP) = (100 + profit %) / (100 - discount %)
Calculation:
Let, the marked price of the article is 100%
He gave a discount of 12%
⇒ After discount selling price of the article (100 - 12) = 88%
Accordingly,
88% → 369.60
⇒ 1% → 369.60/88
⇒ 100% → (369.6/88) × 100 = 420
Marked price of the article = Rs. 420
If he had not given any discount he would have gained 20% that means then discount % should be 0%
MP / CP = (100 + 20) / (100 - 0)
⇒ MP / CP = 120 / 100
⇒ 420 / CP = 6 / 5
⇒ CP = 350
∴ The cost price of the item is Rs. 350.

Question: When positive numbers x, y and z are divided by 31, the remainders are 17, 24 and 27, respectively. When (4x - 2y + 3z) is divided by 31, the remainder will be:
Solution:
Given-
When positive numbers x, y and z are divided by 31, the remainders are 17, 24 and 27
Concept Used-
If a number (x) is divided by (a) leaves remainder (b), then x = a × n + b [where n is an integer]
Calculation-
Let the numbers be,
x = 31 × 1 + 17 = 48
y = 31 × 1 + 24 = 55
z = 31 × 1 + 27 = 58
4x = 4 × 48 = 192
2y = 2 × 55 = 110
3z = 3 × 58 = 174
⇒ (4x - 2y + 3z) = 192 - 110 + 174 = 256
Now,
256 = 31 × 8 + 8
∴ When (4x - 2y + 3z) is divided by 31, the remainder will be 8

Question: As observed from the top of a lighthouse, 120√3 m above the sea level, the angle of depression of a ship sailing towards it changes from 30° to 60°. The distance travelled by ship during the period of observation is:
Solution:
Given-
The height of the lighthouse is 120√3 m above sea level.
Concept Used-
The angle of depression and elevation is the same.
Calculation-

In ΔABD,
tan60° = AB/BD
⇒ √3 = 120√3/BD
⇒ BD = 120
In ΔABC,
tan30° = AB/BC
⇒ 1/√3 = 120√3/BC
⇒ BC = 360
DC = 360 - 120
DC = 240 m

Question:
Study the given graph and answer the question that follows.

In which years was the revenue \(33 \frac{1}{3}\%\) more than the average expenditure of the company during 2014 to 2019?
Solution:
Concept Used-
Average = Sum of Observations/Number of Observations
Calculation-
Average expenditure of the company during 2014 to 2019 = (130 + 150 + 175 + 200 + 165 + 170)/6
⇒ 990/6
⇒ 165
Now, we have to to look for the year in which the revenue is \(33 \frac{1}{3}\%\) more than 165
\(33 \frac{1}{3}\%\) more than 165 = 165 + 165(\(33 \frac{1}{3}\%\))
i.e 165 × 4/3
⇒ 220
∴ The required year is 2018

Question: The value of \(\frac{{{{\cos }^4}\theta + {{\sin }^4}\theta + 2{{\sin }^2}\theta {{\cos }^2}\theta }}{{cosec\theta \sec\theta \left( {\sin\theta + \cos\theta - 1} \right)\left( {\sin\theta + \cos\theta + 1} \right)}}\) is:
Solution:
Given:
\(\frac{{{{\cos }^4}\theta + {{\sin }^4}\theta + 2{{\sin }^2}\theta {{\cos }^2}\theta }}{{cosec\theta sec\theta \left( {sin\theta + cos\theta - 1} \right)\left( {sin\theta + cos\theta + 1} \right)}}\)
Formula Used:
sin4θ + cos4θ = 1 – 2sin2θcos2θ
(a + b) × (a – b) = a2 – b2
sin2θ + cos2θ = 1
cosecθ = 1/sinθ
secθ = 1/cosθ
Calculations:
Considering the given equation,
\(\frac{{{{\cos }^4}\theta + {{\sin }^4}\theta + 2{{\sin }^2}\theta {{\cos }^2}\theta }}{{cosec\theta sec\theta \left( {sin\theta + cos\theta - 1} \right)\left( {sin\theta + cos\theta + 1} \right)}}\)
⇒ (1 – 2sin2θcos2θ + 2sin2θcos2θ)/cosecθsecθ[(sinθ + cosθ)2 – 1]
⇒ 1/cosecθsecθ[(sin2θ + cos2θ + 2sinθcosθ – 1]
⇒ (sinθcosθ)/(1 + 2sinθcosθ – 1)
⇒ (sinθcosθ)/(2sinθcosθ) = 1/2
∴ The value of \(\frac{{{{\cos }^4}\theta + {{\sin }^4}\theta + 2{{\sin }^2}\theta {{\cos }^2}\theta }}{{cosec\theta sec\theta \left( {sin\theta + cos\theta - 1} \right)\left( {sin\theta + cos\theta + 1} \right)}}\)is 1/2.

Question: A certain sum is lent at 4% p.a. for 3 years, 8% p.a. for the next 4 years, and 12% p.a. beyond 7 years. If for a period of 11 years, the simple interest obtained is Rs. 27,600, then the sum is (in Rs):
Solution:
Given:
Simple Interest = Rs. 27,600
Rate of interest for 3 years = 4% p.a.
Rate of interest for next 4 years = 8% p.a.
Rate of interest beyond 7 years = 12% p.a.
Total time period = 11 years
Formula Used:
S.I. = (P × R × T)/100
where, P → Principal, R → Rate of Interest, T → Time period, S.I. → Simple Interest
Calculations:
Let the sum lent be Rs. x.
Simple Interest = Rs. 27,600
Now, S.I. = (P × R × T)/100
For 11 years,
27,600 = (x × 4 × 3)/100 + (x × 8 × 4)/100 + (x × 12 × (11 – 7))/100
⇒ 27,600 = x × (12 + 32 + 48)/100
⇒ 27,600 = x ×( 92/100)
⇒ x = Rs. (27,600 × 100)/92
⇒ x = Rs. 30,000
∴ The sum is Rs. 30,000.

Question: The areas of three adjacent faces of a cuboidal tank are 3 m<sup>2</sup>, 12 m<sup>2</sup> and 16 m<sup>2</sup>. the capacity of the tank, in litres, is:
Solution:
Given:
Areas of 3 adjacent faces of cuboidal tank = 3 m2, 12 m2, 16 m2
Formula Used:
1 m3 = 1000 Litres
If areas of 3 adjacent faces of a cuboid are x, y and z respectively, then
Volume of cuboid = √(x × y × z)
Calculations:
Areas of 3 adjacent faces of cuboidal tank = 3 m2, 12 m2, 16 m2
Volume of cuboid = √(x × y × z)
⇒ Capacity of tank = √(3 × 12 × 16) m3
⇒ Capacity of tank = 24 m3
1 m3 = 1000 Litres
⇒ Capacity of tank = 24 × 1000 lites
⇒ Capacity of tank = 24000 litres
∴ The capacity of the tank, (in litres) is 24000 litres.

Question: A train of length 287 m, running at 80 km/h, crosses another train moving in the opposite direction at 37 km/h in 18 seconds. What is the length of the other train?
Solution:
Given:
Length of first train = 287 m
Speed of first train = 80 km/h
Speed of second train = 37 km/h
Time in which both trains cross = 18 secs
Formula Used:
1 km/hr = (5/18) × m/s
For trains moving in opposite direction,
v1 + v2 = (l1 + l2)/t
where, v1 → Speed of train 1, v2 → Speed of train 2, l1 → Length of train 1
l2 → Length of train 2, t → Time at which both trains meet
Calculations:
Let the length of second train be l m.
Now, v1 + v2 = (l1 + l2)/t
⇒ (80 + 37) × (5/18) = (287 + l)/18
⇒ 117 × (5/18) × 18 = 287 + l
⇒ 585 = 287 + l
⇒ l = 298 m
∴ The length of other train is 298 m.

Question:
Study the given graph and answer the question that follows.

The number of employees = 3000
The total number of employees working in departments A and C exceeds the total number of employees working in departments B and D by x. The value of x lies between:
Solution:
Given:
Total number of employees = 3000
Formula Used:
Number of employees in a department = (x/360°) × Total number of employees
where, x → Angle for employees in department
Calculations:
Total number of employees = 3000
Employees in department A = 64.2°
⇒ Employees in department A = (64.2°/360°) × 3000 = 535
Employees in department C = 72°
⇒ Employees in department C = (72°/360°) × 3000 = 600
Total Employees in department A and C = 535 + 600 = 1135 ----(1)
Employees in department B = 73.8°
⇒ Employees in department B = (73.8°/360°) × 3000 = 615
Employees in department D = 57°
⇒ Employees in department D = (57°/360°) × 3000 = 475
Total Employees in department B and D = 615 + 475 = 1090 ----(2)
Required difference = 1135 – 1090 = 45
⇒ x lies between 44 and 52
Alternate Method
Total angle corresponding to people working in A and C together = 64.2° + 72° = 136.2°
Total angle corresponding to people working in B and D together = 73.8° + 57° = 130.8°
Difference between (A + C) and (B + D) = 136.2° - 130.8° = 5.4° Converting the angle to number = 5.4/360 × 3000 = 45
∴ The value of x lies between 44 and 52.

Question:
Study the given and answer the question that follows.

The number of employees = 3000
If 20% of the employees working in department E are transferred to department A, then the difference between the number of employees in A and 124% of the employes working in department C is:
Solution:
Given:
Total number of employees = 3000
Formula Used:
If P and Q have x and y things and z things are transferred from P to Q, then
Number of things in P = x – z
Number of things in Q = y + z
Calculations:
Total number of employees = 3000
Employees in department E = 93°
⇒ Employees in department E = (93°/360°) × 3000 = 775
20% of Employees of department E = (20/100) × 775
⇒ 20% of Employees of department E = 155
Employees in department A = 64.2°
⇒ Employees in department A = (64.2°/360°) × 3000 = 535
Now, 20% of the employees working in department E are transferred to department A
⇒ Employees in department A = 535 + 155 = 690 ----(1)
Employees in department C = 72°
⇒ Employees in department E = (72°/360°) × 3000 = 600
124% of Employees in department C = (124/100) × 600 = 744 ----(2)
Required difference = (2) – (1)
⇒ Required difference = 744 – 690 = 54
∴ The difference between the number of employees in A and 124% of the employees working in department C is 54.

Question: If \(\frac{5}{4{\sqrt 2 }} + \frac{{3 + 2\sqrt 2 }}{{3 - 2\sqrt 2 }} - \frac{{3 - 2\sqrt 2 }}{{3 + 2\sqrt 2 }} = a + b\sqrt 2\), then what is the value of (3a + 4b)?
Solution:
Given:
\(\frac{5}{4{√ 2 }} + \frac{{3 + 2√ 2 }}{{3 - 2√ 2 }} - \frac{{3 - 2√ 2 }}{{3 + 2√ 2 }} = a + b\sqrt2\)
Formula Used:
1/(√a – √b) = (√a + √b)/(a – b)
(a + b)2= a2+ b2 + 2ab
(a - b)2= a2+ b2​ - 2ab
(a - b)(a + b) = a2- b2
Calculations:
Considering the given equation,
\(\frac{5}{4{√ 2 }} + \frac{{3 + 2√ 2 }}{{3 - 2√ 2 }} - \frac{{3 - 2√ 2 }}{{3 + 2√ 2 }} = a + b\sqrt2\) ----(1)
Rationalizing all the terms one by one
\(\frac{5}{4{√ 2 }}= \frac{5}{4{√ 2 }} \times {√2\over √2}= {{5√2}\over8}\) = \({5\sqrt2}\over8\)
\(\frac{{3 + 2√ 2 }}{{3 - 2√ 2 }} = \frac{{3 + 2√ 2 }}{{3 - 2√ 2 }} \times \frac{{3 + 2√ 2 }}{{3 + 2√ 2 }}= 17 + 12\sqrt2\)
\(\frac{{3 - 2√ 2 }}{{3 + 2√ 2 }} = \frac{{3 - 2√ 2 }}{{3 + 2√ 2 }} \times \frac{{3 - 2√ 2 }}{{3 - 2√ 2 }}= 17 - 12\sqrt2\)
Now, \(\frac{5}{4{\sqrt 2 }} + \frac{{3 + 2\sqrt 2 }}{{3 - 2\sqrt 2 }} - \frac{{3 - 2\sqrt 2 }}{{3 + 2\sqrt 2 }} = a + b\sqrt 2\)
⇒ \({5\sqrt2}\over8\) + 17 + 12√2 - 17 + 12√2 = \(a + b\sqrt2\)
⇒ 0 + \({197\sqrt2}\over8\) = \(a + b\sqrt2\)
By comparing we get, a = 0 and b = 197/8
Now, (3a + 4b) = 3 × 0 + 4 × 197/8 = 197/2
⇒ (3a + 4b) = \(98\frac{1}{2}\)
∴ The value of (3a + 4b) is \(98\frac{1}{2}\).

Question:
Study the given graph and answer the question that follows.

In how many years was the profit (Revenue - Expenditure) as a percentage of the revenue, more than 25% ?
Solution:
Formula Used:
Profit = Revenue – Expenditure
Percentage Revenue = Profit/Revenue × 100
Calculations:
Profit of company in 2014 = Rs.(150 – 130) cr
⇒ Profit of company in 2014 = Rs. 20 cr
Percentage Revenue = Profit/Revenue × 100
Percentage Revenue of company in 2014 = 20/150 × 100 = 13.33% ----(1)
Profit of company in 2015 = Rs.(210 – 150) cr
⇒ Profit of company in 2015 = Rs. 60 cr
Percentage Revenue of company in 2015 = 60/210 × 100 = 28.57% ----(2)
Profit of company in 2016 = Rs.(200 – 175) cr
⇒ Profit of company in 2016 = Rs. 25 cr
Percentage Revenue of company in 2016 = 25/200 × 100 = 12.5% ----(3)
Profit of company in 2017 = Rs.(240 – 200) cr
⇒ Profit of company in 2017 = Rs. 40 cr
Percentage Revenue of company in 2017 = 40/240 × 100 = 16.67% ----(4)
Profit of company in 2018 = Rs.(220 – 165) cr
⇒ Profit of company in 2018 = Rs. 55 cr
Percentage Revenue of company in 2018 = 55/220 × 100 = 25% ----(5)
Profit of company in 2019 = Rs.(255 – 170) cr
⇒ Profit of company in 2019 = Rs. 85 cr
Percentage Revenue of company in 2019 = 85/255 × 100 = 33.33% ----(6)
We observe that only (2) and (6) have profit more than 25%
⇒ Number of years in which profit is more than 25% = 2
∴ The number of years in which profit is more than 25% is 2.

Question: A and B are solutions of acid and water. The ratios of water and acid in A and B are 4 : 5 and 1 : 2 respectively. If x liters of A is mixed with y liters of B, then the ratio of water and acid in the mixture becomes 8 : 13 What is x : y?
Solution:
Shortcut Trick

Now, According to the question
⇒ (4x + 3y)/(5x + 6y) = 8/13
⇒ 52x + 39y = 40x + 48y
⇒ 12x = 9y
⇒ x/y = 9/12
⇒ x/y = 3/4
∴ The ratio of x and y is 3 ∶ 4
Alternate MethodGiven:
Ratio of water and acid in A = 4 ∶ 5
Ratio of water and acid in B = 1 ∶ 2
Calculations:
Taking the ratio of water and acid in A and B in the equal unit,
Ratio of water and acid in A = 4 ∶ 5
Ratio of water and acid in B = 3 ∶ 6
Ratio of water and acid in the mixture = (4x + 3y)/(5x + 6y)
⇒ (4x + 3y)/(5x + 6y) = 8/13
⇒ 52x + 39y = 40x + 48y
⇒ 12x = 9y
⇒ x/y = 9/12
⇒ x/y = 3/4
∴ The ratio of x and y is 3 ∶ 4

Question: The numerator of fraction is 3 more than the denominator. When 5 is added to the numerator and 2 is subtracted from the denominator, the fraction becomes 8/3, When the original fraction is divided by \(5 \frac{1}{2}\), the fraction so obtained is:
Solution:
Given:
Numerator = Denominator + 3
Number which will divide original fraction = 5.5 = 11/2
Concept used:
Fraction = Numerator/Denominator
Calculations:
Let the numerator and denominator be x and y respectively
⇒ x = y + 3
Fraction = x/y
⇒ (y + 3)/y
When 5 is added to the numerator and 2 is subtracted from denominator,
⇒ (y + 3 + 5)/(y – 2) = 8/3
⇒ (y + 8)/(y – 2) = 8/3
⇒ 3y + 24 = 8y – 16
⇒ 5y = 40
⇒ y = 8
Fraction = (8 + 3)/8
⇒ 11/8
Dividing the original fraction by (11/2),
⇒ (11/8)/(11/2)
⇒ (2/8)
⇒ 1/4
∴ The newly obtained fraction is 1/4

Question: In ΔABC, the bisector of ∠A intersects side BC at D. If AB = 12 cm, AC = 15 cm and BC = 18 cm, then the length of BD is
Solution:
Given:
AB = 12 cm
AC = 15 cm
BC = 18 cm
Concept used:
The angle bisector of an angle of a triangle divides the opposite side into two parts that are proportional to the other two sides of the triangle.
Calculations:

The length of BC is,
BC = BD + DC
⇒ DC = 18 – BD
Using the concept,
⇒ BD/DC = AB/AC
⇒ BD/(18 – BD) = 12/15
⇒ BD/(18 – BD) = 4/5
⇒ 5BD = 72 – 4BD
⇒ 9BD = 72
⇒ BD = 8 cm
∴ The length of BD is 8 cm

Question: The lengths of two sides of a parallelogram are 3 cm and 10 cm. What is the sum of the squares of the diagonals of the parallelogram?
Solution:
Given:
First side of parallelogram = 3 cm
Second side of parallelogram = 10 cm
Concept used:
The sum of the squares of the diagonals of a parallelogram is equal to the sum of squares of its sides
Calculations:
Let the parallelogram be ABCD,
AB = 3 cm
BC = 10 cm
CD = 3 cm
DA = 10 cm
Using the concept,
The sum of the squares of the diagonals = (AB2 + BC2 + CD2 + DA2)
⇒ (32 + 102 + 32 + 102)
⇒ (9 + 100 + 9 + 100)
⇒ 218
∴ The sum of the squares of the diagonals of the parallelogram is 218 cm2

Question: The monthly incomes of A and B are in the ration 3 : 5 and the ratio of their savings is 2 : 3 If the income of B is equal to three times the savings of A, then what is the ratio of the expenditures of A and B?
Solution:
Given:
Monthly incomes of A and B are in the ratio = 3 ∶ 5
The ratio of their savings = 2 ∶ 3
The income of B = 3 × Savings of A
Concept used:
Income = Savings + Expenditure
Calculations:
Let the monthly income of A and B be 300 and 500 and the savings be 2x and 3x respectively
⇒ 500 = 3 × 2x
⇒ 500 = 6x
⇒ x = 250/3
Expenditure of A = Income of A – Savings of A
⇒ 300 – 2 × (250/3)
⇒ (900 – 500)/3
⇒ 400/3
Expenditure of B = Income of B – Savings of B
⇒ 500 – 3 × (250/3)
⇒ 500 – 250
⇒ 250
Ratio of expenditure of A and B = (400/3)/250
⇒ 400/750
⇒ 8/15
∴ The ratio of the expenditures of A and B is 8 ∶ 15

Question: X and Y enter into a partnership with capital in the ratio 3 ∶ 5 After 5 months X adds 50% of his capital, while Y withdraws 60% of his capital. What is the share (in Rs. lakhs) of X in the annual profit of Rs. 6.84 lakhs?
Solution:
Given:
X and Y enter into partnership with capital in the ratio = 3 ∶ 5
After 5 months,
X's capital = 150% of initial investment of X
Y's capital = 40% of initial investment of Y
Annual profit = Rs. 6.84 lakhs
Formula used:
(X's profit) ∶ (Y's profit) = (X's capital × Time period of investment) ∶ (Y's capital × Time period of investment)
Calculations:
Let X's and Y's initial investment for the first 5 months be 30 and 50
After 5 months,
X's capital for next 7 months = (150/100) × 30 = 45
Y's capital for next 7 months = (40/100) × 50 = 20
(X's profit)/(Y's profit) = [(30 × 5) + (45 × 7)]/[(50 × 5) + (20 × 7)]
⇒ (150 + 315)/(250 + 140)
⇒ 465/390
⇒ 31/26
Total profit = 31 + 26 = 57 units
⇒ (X's profit)/(Total profit) = 31/57
⇒ (X's profit)/6.84 = 31/57
⇒ X's profit = (31/57) × 6.84
⇒ X's profit = 3.72
∴ The profit earned by X is Rs. 3.72 lakhs

Question: The average of three numbers a, b and c is 12 more than c. The average of a and b is 48. If d is 10 less than c, then the average of c and d is:
Solution:
Given:
Average of three numbers a, b, and c = 12 + c
Average of a and b = 48
d = c – 10
Formula used:
Average = Sum of observations/Number of observations
Calculations:
Average of a and b = (a + b)/2
⇒ (a + b)/2 = 48
⇒ a + b = 96 ----(i)
Average of three numbers a, b, and c = (a + b + c)/3
⇒ (a + b + c)/3 = 12 + c
⇒ a + b + c = 36 + 3c
⇒ a + b = 36 + 2c
Using (i),
⇒ 96 = 36 + 2c
⇒ 2c = 60
⇒ c = 30
Then,
⇒ d = 30 – 10
⇒ d = 20
Average of c and d = (c + d)/2
⇒ (30 + 20)/2
⇒ 50/2
⇒ 25
∴ The average of c and d is 25

Question: The radius and height of a right circular cone are in the ratio 3 : 4. If its curved surface area (in cm<sup>2</sup>) is 240 π, then its volume (in cm<sup>3</sup>) is:
Solution:
Given:
Ratio of radius and height of the cone = 3 ∶ 4
Curved surface area = 240 π cm2
Formula used:
Curved surface area of cone = π r l
Volume of cone = (1/3) π r2 h
Slant height = √(h2 + r2)
Where,
r = Radius of the cone
h = Height of the cone
l = slant height
Calculations:

Let the radius and height of the cone be 3x and 4x
Slant height = √[(4x)2 + (3x)2]
⇒ √(16x2 + 9x2)
⇒ √25x2
⇒ 5x
Curved suface area = π × 3x × 5x
⇒ 240 π = π × 15x2
⇒ x2 = 16
⇒ x = 4
Radius = 12 cm
Height = 16 cm
Slant height = 20 cm
Volume of the cone = (1/3) × π × 144 × 16
⇒ 48 × 16 × π
⇒ 768 π
∴ The volume of the cone is 768 π cm3

Question: Anuja owns \(66 \frac{2}{3}\%\) of a property. If 30% of the property that she owns is worth Rs. 1,25,000, then 45% of the value (in Rs) of the property is:
Solution:
Given :
Anuja owns \(66{ 2\ \over 3}\)% or (2/3) of a property (\(66{2 \ \over 3}\)% = 2/3)
30% of Anuja's owns property worth Rs. 125000
Calculations :
Let the worth of the property be 'x'
According to the question
30% of (2/3) of x = 125000
⇒ x = Rs. 625000
45% of 625000 = (45/100) of 625000
⇒ Rs. 281250
∴ The value of 45% of the total property will be Rs. 281250

Question: The sum of radii spheres A and B is 14 cm, the radius of A being larger than that of B. The difference between their surface areas is 112 π. What is the ratio of the volumes of A and B?
Solution:
Given :
The Difference between the surface area of the spheres is 112π
The sum of the radii of spheres of A and B is 14 cm
Radius of A is larger than the radius of B
Formula used :
Area of a sphere = 4 π r2 (where 'r' is the radius of the sphere)
Volume of a sphere = (4/3) π r3 (where 'r' is the radius of the sphere)
Calculations :
Let the radius of the circle A be 'a'
Let the radius of the circle B be 'b'
Difference of the surface area of the circle is 112π
4 π a2 - 4 π b2 = 112 π
(a + b).(a - b) = 28
a-b = 2 [Given,(a + b) = 2]
a + b = 14 ....(1)
a - b = 2 ....(2)
Solving equation (1) and (2)
⇒ a = 8 and b = 6
So,
Volume of sphere with radius a cm : volume of sphere with radius b cm = 4 π a3 : 4 π b3
⇒ 83 : 63
⇒ 512 : 216
⇒ 64 : 27
∴ The ratio of the volume will be 64 : 27

Question: The perimeters of ΔABC and ΔDEF are 43.2 cm and 28.8 cm, respectively, and ΔABC ~ ΔDEF. If DE = 12 cm, then the length of AB is:
Solution:
Given :
Perimeters of ∆ABC and ∆DEF are 43.2 and 28.8 cm respectively
∆ABC and ∆DEF are similar
Concept used :
If ∆ABC similar to ∆DEF then,
The perimeter of ∆ABC/Perimeter of ∆DEF = AB/DE = BC/EF = AC/DF
Calculations :
According to the question
43.2/28.8 = AB/12
⇒ AB = 18
∴ The length of AB is 18 cm

Question: If 27(x + y)<sup>3</sup> - 8(x - y)<sup>3</sup> = (x + 5y)(Ax<sup>2</sup> + By<sup>2</sup> + Cxy), then what is the value of (A + B - C)?
Solution:
Given :
27(x + y)3 - 8(x - y)3 = (x + 5y)(Ax2 + By2 + Cxy)
Formula used :
P3 - q3 = (p - q) (p2 + q2 + pq)
Calculations :
27(x + y)3 - 8(x - y)3 = [3(x + y)]3 - [2(x - y)]3
we use given formula above
⇒ [3(x + y) - 2(x - y)] [(3x + 3y)2 + (2x - 2y)2 + 3(x + y) × 2(x - y)]
⇒ (x + 5y) (19x2 + 7y2 + 10xy)
Now compare (x + 5y) (19x2 + 7y2 + 10xy) with (x + 5y)(Ax2 + By2 + Cxy)
We will get A = 19, B = 7 and C = 10
So,
A + B - C = 19 + 7 - 10
⇒ 16
∴ The value of A + B - C is 16

Question: When 1062, 1134 and 1182 are divided by the greatest numbers x, remainder in each case is y. What is the value of (x - y)?
Solution:
Concept used :
HCF is the highest common factor
If 3 numbers A, B and C are divided by a greatest number 'P' and leaves the same remainder each time, then the value of P will be HCF of (A - B) (B - C) and (A - C)
Calculations :
We have to find HCF of (1134 - 1062), (1182 - 1134) and (1182 - 1062)
1134 - 1062 = 72
1182 - 1134 = 48
1182 - 1062 = 120
⇒ 72 = 23 × 32
⇒ 48 = 24 × 3
⇒ 120 = 23 × 3 × 5
HCF of 72, 48 and 120 is 23 × 3 = 24 (24 is the highest common factor among all)
Now,
Remainder when 1062 is divided by 24 is 6
So, x = 24 and y = 6
⇒ x - y = 24 - 6
⇒ 18
∴ The value of (x - y) will be 18

Question: Pipes A and B can fill a tank in 43.2 minutes and 108 minutes, respectively. Pipe C can empty it at 3 litres/minute. When all the three pipes are opened together, they fill the tank in 54 minutes. The capacity (in litres) of the tank is:
Solution:
Given :
Pipe A can fill the tank in 43.2 minutes
Pipe B can fill the tank in 108 minutes
Pipe C can empty 3 litres/minute
All of them take 54 minutes to fill the tank
Formula used :
Pipe A is filling pipe and take time a to fill the tank
Pipe B is filling pipe and take time b to fill the tank
Pipe C is a drain pipe and takes time c to empty the tank
If all of them take total 't' time to fill the tank then
1/t = (1/a) + (1/b) - (1/c)
Calculation:
Let the time taken by pipe C be 'c' minutes
According to the question
1/54 = (1/43.2) + (1/108) - (1/c)
⇒ c = 72 minutes
The capacity of the tank = water drain per minutes by pipe C × Total time
⇒ 3 × 72
⇒ 216 litres
∴ The capacity of the tank will be 216 litres
Alternate Method
Formula used:
Efficiency = Total work/Time
Calculation:
LCM of 43.2, 108 and 54 = 432 units = Total work
Efficiency of A = 432/43.2 = 10 units/min
Efficiency of B = 432/108 = 4 units/min
Efficiency of (A + B + C) = 432/54 = 8 units/min
Efficiency of C = (10 + 4 – 8) units/min
⇒ 6 units/min
Capacity of tank = (432/6) × 3 litres
⇒ (72 × 3) litres
⇒ 216 litres
∴ The capacity of tank is 216 litres

Question: Given that x<sup>8</sup> - 34x<sup>4</sup> + 1 = 0, x > 0. What is the value of (x<sup>3</sup> + x<sup>-3</sup>)?
Solution:
Given :
x8 - 34x4 + 1 = 0 , x > 0
Formula used :
(x + y)2 = x2+ y2 + 2xy
(x + y)3 = x3 + y3 + 3xy(x + y)
Calculations :
x8 - 34x4 + 1 = 0
Divide both the sides of the equation by x4 , then equation will become
x4 - 34 + x-4 = 0
⇒ x4 + x-4 = 34
Adding 2 to both the sides of the equation
x4+ x-4 + 2 = 36
⇒ (x2 + x-2)2 = 36
⇒ x2+ x-2= 6
Again adding 2 to both the sides of the equation
x2+ x-2 + 2 = 8
⇒ (x1 + x-1)2 = 8
⇒ x + x-1 = 2√2
Now cube both the sides of the equation
(x + x-1)3 = (2√2)3
⇒ x3 + x-3 + 3(x + x-1) = (2√2)3
⇒ x3 + x-3 + 3(2√2) = 16√2
⇒ x3 + x-3 + 6√2 = 16√2
⇒ x3 + x-3= 10√2
∴ The value of x3 + x-3 = 10√2

Question: A solid metallic sphere of radius 15 cm is melted and recast into spherical balls of radius 3 cm each. What is the ratio of the surface area of original sphere and sum of the surface areas of all the balls?
Solution:
Given :
Solid metallic sphere of radius 15 cm
Bigger sphere is melted into smaller spheres of radius 3 cm
Formula used :
Surface area of sphere = 4π r2
Volume of the sphere = (4/3)π r3 (where r is the radius of the sphere)
Calculations :
Let the number of the smaller sphere be 'x'
Volume of the bigger sphere = x × (volume of the smaller sphere)
(4/3)π 153 = x × (4/3)π 33
x = 125
So their are total 125 smaller spheres
Now,
The surface area of the larger sphere = 4π 152
⇒ 900π
Surface area of smaller sphere = 4π 32
⇒ 36π
Total surface area of 125 smaller spheres = 125 × 36π
⇒ 4500π
Surface area of the bigger sphere : Surface area of all smaller spheres = 900π : 4500π
⇒ 1 : 5
∴ The required ratio will be 1 : 5

Question: The value of \(\frac{{0.0203 \times 2.92}}{{0.7 \times 0.0365 \times 2.9}} \div \frac{{{{\left( {12.12} \right)}^2} - {{\left( {8.12} \right)}^2}}}{{{{\left( {0.25} \right)}^2} + \left( {0.25} \right)\left( {19.99} \right)}}\) is:
Solution:
We should use the BODMAS rule according to the following table:

Calculation:
\(\frac{{0.0203 \times 2.92}}{{0.7 \times 0.0365 \times 2.9}} ÷ \frac{{{{\left( {12.12} \right)}^2} - {{\left( {8.12} \right)}^2}}}{{{{\left( {0.25} \right)}^2} + \left( {0.25} \right)\left( {19.99} \right)}}\)
\(\rm Let \; \frac{{0.0203 \times 2.92}}{{0.7 \times 0.0365 \times 2.9}}\; be\; 'a'\; and \; \frac{{{{\left( {12.12} \right)}^2} - {{\left( {8.12} \right)}^2}}}{{{{\left( {0.25} \right)}^2} + \left( {0.25} \right)\left( {19.99} \right)}}\; be \;'b'\)
⇒ a ÷ b ----(1)
\(⇒ a = \frac{{0.0203 \times 2.92}}{{0.7 \times 0.0365 \times 2.9}}\)
\(⇒ a = \frac{{203 \times 292 \times 1/10^6}}{{7 \times 365 \times 29 \times 1/10^6}}\)
\(⇒ a = \frac{{292}}{{365}} = 0.8\) ---(2)
\(⇒ b= \frac{{{{\left( {12.12} \right)}^2} - {{\left( {8.12} \right)}^2}}}{{{{\left( {0.25} \right)}^2} + \left( {0.25} \right)\left( {19.99} \right)}}\)
\(⇒ b= \frac{{{{\left( {12.12}\;+\;8.12\right)}} {{\left( {12.12\;-\;8.12} \right)}}}}{{{{\left( {0.25} \right)}^2} + \left( {0.25} \right)\left( {19.99} \right)}}\)
\(⇒ b= \frac{{{{\left( {20.24}\right)}} {{\left( {4} \right)}}}}{{{{\left( {0.25} \right)}^2} + \left( {0.25} \right)\left( {19.99} \right)}}\)
⇒ b = (20.24)(4)/(0.25)(0.25 + 19.99)
⇒ b = (20.24)(4)/(0.25)(20.24)
\(⇒ b = {{4} \over 0.25} = 16\) ---(3)
Put the value of a and b from eq. (2) and (3) to (1)
⇒ a ÷ b = 0.8/16 = 0.05
∴ The correct answer is 0.05.

Question: cosA(secA - cosA)(cotA + tanA)=?
Solution:
Given:
cosA(secA - cosA)(cotA + tanA)
Formula Used:
1 – cos2A = sin2A
1 + tan2A = sec2A
Calculation:
cosA(secA - cosA)(cotA + tanA)
⇒ cosA(\(1\over cosA\) - cosA)(\(1\over tanA\) + tanA)
⇒ (1 – cos2A)(\({1+ tan^2A}\over tanA\))
⇒ sin2A × \({1+ tan^2A}\over tanA\)
⇒ sin2A × \(sec^2A\over tanA\) = sin2A × \({1}\over{cos^2A \times tanA}\) (tanA = \(sinA\over cosA\))
⇒ \({tan^2A}\over{tanA}\) = tan A
∴ cosA(secA - cosA) (cotA + tanA) = tanA

Question:
Directions: Study the given graph and answer the question that follows.

The number of employees = 3000
The number of employees in department B is what percent of the total number of employees working in department D and E?
Solution:
Given:
Total number of Employees = 3000
The number of employees in department B (in degree) = 74°
The number of employees in department D (in degree) = 57°
The number of employees in department E (in degree)= 93°
Concept:
360° represent 100% in a pie chart.
Detailed Solution:
The number of employees in department B = (74°/360°) × 3000 = 616.6
The number of employees in department D = (57°/360°) × 3000 = 475
The number of employees in department E = (93°/360°) × 3000 = 775
The number of employees in department D and E together = 475 + 775 = 1250
⇒ Required percentage =\(Number \ of \ employees \ in \ department \ B \ \over Number \ of \ employees \ in \ department \ D \ and \ E \\)× 100 = (616.6/1250) × 100 = 49.3%
∴ The required percentage is 49.3%
Shortcut Trick
Short Solution:
The number of employees in department B (in degree) = 74°
The number of employees in department D and E (in degree) = 57° + 93° = 150°
⇒ Required percentage =\(employees \ in \ department B \ (in \ degree)\over employees \ in \ department \ D \ and \ E \ (in\ degree)\)× 100 = (74°/150°) × 100 = 49.3%
∴ The required percentage is 49.3%

Question: If the 5-digit number 535ab is divisible by 3, 7 and 11 then what is the value of (a<sup>2</sup> - b<sup>2</sup> + ab)?
Solution:
Shortcut Trick
If 5 digit number 535ab is divisible by 3, 7 and 11, then we can say number also divisible by 231 because = (3 × 7 × 11= 231).
let assume the largest number be 53599.
Now on dividing 53599 by 231
we get approx 232.92
So, the actual number = 231 × 232 = 53592
∴ a = 9 and b = 2.
⇒ (a2 - b2 + ab) = (92 - 22 + 9 × 2)
⇒ (a2 - b2 + ab) = 81 - 4 + 18
∴ (a2 - b2 + ab) = 95
Alternate Method
Concept:
Divisibility law of 3
⇒ A number is divisible by 3 if sum of its digit is divisible by 3.
Divisibility law of 11
⇒ If the difference of the alternating sum of digits of the number is a multiple of 11
(e.g. 2343 is divisible by 11 because 2 - 3 + 4 - 3 = 0, which is a multiple of 11).
(e.g. 2343 is divisible by 11 because (2 + 4) - (3 + 3) = 0, which is a multiple of 11).
Calculations:
If 5 digit number 535ab is divisible by 3, 7 and 11, then we can say number also divisible by 231 because = (3 × 7 × 11= 231).
From Divisibility law of 3 :
535ab is divisible by 3 if sum of its digit divisible by 3, so
5 + 3 + 5 + a + b
13 + a + b
As we know, (13 + a + b) is divisibly by 3 such that it can lie between minimum 15 and maximum 30.
⇒15 ≤ 13 + a + b ≤ 30
⇒ 2 ≤ a + b ≤ 17
⇒ 2 ≤ a + b ≤ 17 ----(i)
From Divisibility law of 11 : 5 digit number 535ab is divisible by 11 so definition from the divisibility law by 11 5 – 3 + 5 – a + b = 0 (5 + 5 + b) – (3 + a) = 0 ⇒ (10 + b) – (3 + a) = 0 ⇒ (b – a) = -7 ----(ii) such that a > b Possible cases:
a987
b210
Possible numbers are 1. 53592 ⇒ sum of digits is 24 it is divisible by 3 2. 53581 ⇒ sum of digits is 22 it is not divisible by 3 3. 53570 ⇒ sum of digits is 20 it is not divisible by 3 So, 53592 is the only possible number that is divisible by 3.
Also by checking divisibility of 53592 is also divisible by 7
So,53592 is the only possible number which is divisible by 3, 7 and 11
∴ a = 9 and b = 2.
⇒ (a2 - b2 + ab) = (92 - 22 + 9 × 2)
⇒ (a2 - b2 + ab) = 81 - 4 + 18
∴ (a2 - b2 + ab) = 95

Additional Information
Divisibility Test for 7
To Find out if a number is divisible by 7 or not, follow these steps:
1. Separate the last digit from the rest of the number. Let us call the rest of the number the truncated number. The truncated number has one less
digit than the original number or the previous truncated number.
2. Double the last digit and subtract it from the truncated number.
3. Check if this result is sufficiently small so that you can immediately say if this is divisible by 7. If it is divisible by 7, then so was the original
number. If it is not divisible by 7, then neither was the original number.
4. If the number is still too large to visually check if it is divisible, apply this rule over and over again as necessary.
E.g.Check 6132.
The last digit is 2 and the truncated number is 613.
Twice of 2 is 4. So subtract 4 from the truncated number 613 i.e. 613 – 4 = 609.
Again, the last digit is now 9, and the truncated number is 60.
Twice of 9 is 18. Subtract it from the truncated number 60, i.e. 60 – 18 = 42.
Now 42 is small enough to check visually.
We know that 42 is divisible by 7, so we can tell that 6132 is divisible by 7 also.

NOTE:
Explaining this step is long. But actually using it is a very short and time-saving method. This method is especially useful in Geometry and
Mensuration problems where the value of π plays an important role.

Question: If the radius of the base of a right circular cylinder is increased by 20% and the height is decreased by 30%, then what is the percentage increase/decrease in the volume?
Solution:
Given:
Radius 20% increase
Height 30% decrease
Formula used:
Volume of cylinder = πr2h
20% → 1/5
30% → 3/10
Calculation:
Let the initial radius, height be r, h
⇒ New radius = r + r/5 = 6r/5
⇒ New height = h – 3h/10 = 7h/10
⇒ New Volume = π × 36r2/25 × 7h/10 = 252πr2h/250
∴% increase in Volume = \({2\over 250}\times 100\) = 0.8%

Question: The area (in sq. units) of the triangle formed by the graphs of 8x + 3y = 24, 2x + 8 = y and the x-axis is:
Solution:
Given:
8x + 3y = 24, 2x + 8 = y and the x-axis
Formula used:
Area of triangle = 1/2 × base × height
The Y co-ordinate of point of intersection of the two lines 8x + 3y = 24, 2x + 8 = y gives the height of the triangle.
The difference between the x intercepts of the lines 8x + 3y = 24, 2x + 8 = y gives the base of the triangle
Calculation:
For 8x + 3y = 24, 2x + 8 = y to find the point of intersection put one equation in other
⇒ 8x + 3(2x + 8) = 24
⇒ 14x = 0
⇒ x = 0
⇒ y = 2×0 + 8 = 8
⇒ Height of the triangle = 8
For 8x + 3y = 24, 2x + 8 = y to find the X – intercepts put y = 0
⇒ 8x + 3×0 = 24
⇒ x1 = 3
⇒ 2x + 8 = 0
⇒ x2 = -4
Their difference is the base = 3 – (-4) = 7
∴ The area of triangle = 8 × 7/2 = 28

Question: A is 80% more than B and C is 48(4/7) % less than the sum of A and B. By what per cent is C less than A?
Solution:
Shortcut TrickLet the value of B be 100
⇒ A = 100 × 180% = 180
⇒ (A + B) = 280
According to the question C = \(51 \frac{3}{7}\%\) of 280
⇒ C = \(\frac{360}{700} \times 280 = 144\)
So, Required% = \(\frac{180 - 144}{180} \times 100\%\)
∴ The required% is 20%
Alternate Method
Given:
A is 80% more than B
C is \(48 \frac{4}{7}\%\) less than A + B
Formula Used:
80% → 4/5
Calculation:
⇒ A = (1 + 4/5)B = 9B/5
⇒ C = (100% - \(48 \frac{4}{7}\%\))(A + B) = \(51 \frac{3}{7}\%\)(9B/5 + B)
⇒ C = (3.6/7) × (14B/5) = 7.2B/5
Difference between A and C = 1.8B/5
⇒ Percentage = \(1.8B/5\over9B/5\) × 100 = 0.2 × 100 = 20%
∴ The required percentage = 20%

Question: In a school 3/8 of the number of students are girls and the rest are boys. One-third of the number of boys are below 10 years and 2/3 the number of girls are also below 10 years. If the number of students of age 10 or more years is 260. then the number of boys in the school is:
Solution:
Given:
Girls → 3/8
Boys → 5/8
1/3rd of Boys are below 10 years
2/3rd of Girls are below 10 years
Total 260 students above age 10
Calculation:
Let the total students be x
⇒ Boys = 5x/8, Girls = 3x/8
⇒ Boys above age 10 = 2/3rd of Total boys = 5x/12
⇒ Girls above age 10 = 1/3rd of Total girls = x/8
⇒ 5x/12 + x/8 = 260
⇒ x = 480
∴ Total boys = 5x/8 = 300

Question: A certain number of students from school X appeared in an examination and 30% of the students failed. 150% more students than those from school X, appeared in the same examination from school Y. If 80% of the total number of students who appeared from X and Y passed, then what is the percentage of students who failed from Y?
Solution:
Calculation:
30% of the students from school X failed
Let the number of students from school X be 100
⇒ Number of students who failed = 30
⇒ Number of students who passed = (100 - 30) = 70
According to the question,
150% more students than school X, appeared in the examination from school Y
Number of students from school Y = 100 + [100 × (150/100)]
⇒ Number of students from school Y = 250
Again, according to the question,
80% of the total number of students from X and Y passed
Total students from school X and Y = 100 + 250 = 350
⇒ Total number of students who passed = 350 × (80/100)
⇒ Total number of students who passed = 280
Now,
Number of students who passed from school Y = 280 - 70
⇒ Number of students who passed from school Y = 210
Number of students who failed from school Y = 250 - 210
⇒ Number of students who failed from school Y = 40
Percentage of students who failed from Y = (40/250) × 100
⇒ Percentage of students who failed from Y = 16%
∴ 16% of students failed from school Y.
Shortcut Trick
Ratio of students from school X to Y = 2 : 5
30% of the students from school X failed
⇒ 70% of the students from school X passed
80% of the total number of students from X and Y passed
By mixture allegation method

84% of students from school Y passed
Percentage of students failed from school Y = 100 - 84
⇒ Percentage of students failed from school Y = 16%

Question: The radii of two right circular cylinders are in the ratio 3 : 2 and the of their volumes is 27 : 16. What is the ratio of their heights?
Solution:
Given:
Ratio of radius of two right circular cylinders = 3 : 2
Ratio of their volumes = 27 : 16
Formula used:
Volume of right circular cylinder = πr2h
Calculation:
let the height of both cylinder be h1 and h2
⇒ π32h1/π22h2 = 27 : 16
⇒ 9h1/4h2 = 27 : 16
⇒ 4h1 = 3h2
⇒ h1: h2 = 3 : 4
∴ The ratio of their heights is 3 : 4

Question: An article is marked 35% above its cost. If a profit of 20% is earned by selling the article, then the discount per cent offered on the marked price of the article is:
Solution:
Given:
Marked price = 35% above the cost price
Profit% = 20%
Formula used:
Discount% = (Discount/M.P) × 100%
Calculation:
Let the cost price be Rs. 100x
Marked price = Rs. 100x × (135/100)
⇒ Rs. 135x
Selling price = Rs. 100x × (120/100)
⇒ Rs. 120x
Discount = Rs. (135x – 120x)
⇒ Rs. 15x
Discount% = (15x/135x) × 100%
⇒ 100/9%
∴ The discount% offered on the marked price is 100/9%

Question: How many kg of rice costing Rs. 42 per kg should be mixed with \(7\frac{1}{2}\) kg rice costing Rs. 50 per kg so that by selling the mixture at Rs. 53.10 per kg, there is gain of 18%?
Solution:
Given:
Price of one quality of rice = Rs. 42/kg
Price of quality of rice = Rs. 50/kg
Quantity of other quality of rice = 7.5 kg
S.P pf the mixture = Rs. 53.10
Gain = 18%
Formula used:
C.P = S.P × [100/(100 + gain%)]
Calculation:
C.P of mixture = Rs. (53.10/118) × 100
⇒ Rs. 45
Let the quantity of rice costing Rs. 42 per kg be x kg
Now, as per the alligation method
(50 – 45) : (45 – 42) = x : 7.5
⇒ 5 : 3 = x : 7.5
⇒ x = 2.5 × 5
⇒ 12.5 kg
∴ The quantity of rice costing Rs. 42 per kg is 12.5 kg

Question: A, B and C started a business. Twice the investment of A is equal to thrice the investment of B and also five times the investment of C. If the total profit after a year is Rs. 15.5 lakhs, then the share of B in the profit is (in Rs. lakhs):
Solution:
Given:
Twice the investment of A = Thrice the investment of B = Five times the investment of C
Total profit = Rs. 15.5 lakhs
Concept used:
Profit will be directly proportional to amount invested if time period is same
Calculation:
2A = 3B = 5C
L.C.M of 2, 3 and 5 = 30
So, A = 30/2 = 15
⇒ B = 30/3 = 10
⇒ C = 30/5 = 6
Total profit = 15 + 10 + 6 = 31
Share of B = (10/31) × 15.5 lakhs
⇒ Rs. 5 lakhs
∴ The share of B is Rs. 5 lakhs

Question: In a circle with center O, BC is a chord. Points P and A are on the circle, on the opposite side of BC, such that ∠ PBC = 28° and BP = PC. What is the measure of the inverse angle of BOC?
Solution:
Given:
The Centre of the circle is O
BC is a chord of the circle
∠PBC = 28° and BP = PC
Concept used:
The complete angle is 360°
In a triangle opposite angles of equal sides are equal.
The Sum of all internal angle in a triangle is 180°
The angle subtended by an arc of a circle at its centre is twice the angle it subtends anywhere on the circle's circumference.
Calculations:


∠PBC = ∠PCB = 28°
In ΔPBC,
∠PBC + ∠PCB + ∠BPC = 180°
⇒ 28° + 28° + ∠BPC = 180°
⇒ 56° + ∠BPC = 180°
⇒ ∠BPC = 180° – 56°
⇒ ∠BPC = 124°
⇒ ∠BOC = 2 × ∠BPC
⇒ ∠BOC = 2 × 124°
⇒ ∠BOC = 248°
Complete angle at O = 360°
⇒ 248° + ∠BOC = 360°
⇒ inverse∠BOC = 112°
∴ The value of Inverse ∠BOC is 112°

Question: A can do 20% of a work in 4 days. B can do 33.33% work in 10 days. They worked together for 9 days. C complete the remaining work in 6 days. B and C together will complete 75% of the same work in:
Solution:
Given:
Time taken by A to complete 20% work = 4 days
Time taken by B to complete 33.33% of work = 10 days
They worked together for 9 days
C completed the remaining work in 6 days
Formula used:
Work = Time × Efficiency
Calculation:
Time taken by A to complete 100% work = 4 × 5 = 20 days
Time taken by B to complete 100% work = 10 × 3 = 30 days
L.C.M of 20 and 30 = 60 = Total work
Efficiency of A = 60/20 = 3 units/day
Efficiency of B = 60/30 = 2 units/day
Worked done by A and B together in 9 days = (3 + 2) × 9
⇒ 45 units
Remaining work = (60 – 45) units
⇒ 15 units
C can complete the remaining work in 6 days
Efficiency of C = 15/6 = 2.5 units/day
Total efficiency of B and C = (2 + 2.5) units/day
⇒ 4.5 units/day
Now, 75% of total work = 75% of 60 units
⇒ 45 units
Required time = 45/4.5 days
⇒ 10 days
∴ B and C can complete 75% work in 10 days

Question: Shashi sells two articles for Rs. 5,000 each with no loss and no profit in the overall transaction. If one article is sold at \(16 \frac{2}{3}\%\) loss, then the other is sold at a profit of:
Solution:
Given:
S.P of two articles = Rs. 5000 each
Loss on one article = 50/3%
Formula used:
C.P = S.P × [100/(100 – loss%)]
Calculation:
C.P of one article = Rs. 5000 × [100/(250/3)]
⇒ Rs. 5000 × 100 × (3/250)
⇒ Rs. 6000
Now, As the there is no profit or no loss
So, C.P of other article = Rs. (10,000 – 6000)
⇒ Rs. 4000
S.P of other article = Rs. 5000
Gain = Rs. (5000 – 4000)
⇒ Rs. 1000
Gain% = (1000/4000) × 100%
⇒ 25%
∴ The other article is sold at 25% profit

Question: \(\frac{{sin\theta [\left( {1 - tan\theta } \right)tan\theta + {{\sec }^2}\theta ]}}{{\left( {1 - \sin \theta } \right)\tan \theta \left( {1 + tan\theta } \right)\left( {sec\theta + tan\theta } \right)}}\) is equal to:
Solution:
GIVEN:
\(\frac{{sinθ [\left( {1 - tanθ } \right)tanθ + {{\sec }^2}θ ]}}{{\left( {1 - \sin θ } \right)\tan θ \left( {1 + tanθ } \right)\left( {secθ + tanθ } \right)}}\)
FORMULA USED:
\({\sec ^2}θ - \;{\tan ^2}θ = 1\), sin2θ + cos2θ = 1. tanθ = sinθ/cosθ, secθ = 1/cosθ
CALCULATION:
\(\frac{{sinθ [\left( {1 - tanθ } \right)tanθ + {{\sec }^2}θ ]}}{{\left( {1 - \sin θ } \right)\tan θ \left( {1 + tanθ } \right)\left( {secθ + tanθ } \right)}}\)
\(⇒ \;\frac{{\sin θ \;[\tan θ - \;{{\tan }^2}θ + \;1 + \;{{\tan }^2}θ ]}}{{(1 - \;\sin θ )\;\tan θ \;(1 + \;\tan θ )\;(\sec θ + \;\tan θ )}}\)
\(⇒ \frac{{\sin θ \;(1 + \;\tan θ )}}{{(1 - \sin θ )\;\tan θ \;(1 + \;\tan θ )\;(\sec θ + \;\tan θ )}}\)
\(⇒ \;\frac{{\sin θ }}{{(1 - \;\sin θ )\;\frac{{\sin θ }}{{\cos θ }}\;(\sec θ + \;\tan θ )}}\)
\(⇒ \;\frac{{\cos θ }}{{(1 - \;\sin θ )\;\left( {\frac{1}{{\cos θ }} + \;\frac{{\sin θ }}{{\cos θ }}} \right)}}\)
\(⇒ \frac{{{{\cos }^2}θ }}{{(1 - \sin θ )\;(1 + \;\sin θ )}}\)
\(⇒ \frac{{{{\cos }^2}θ }}{{(1 - \;{{\sin }^2}θ )}}\)
\(⇒ \;\frac{{{{\cos }^2}θ }}{{{{\cos }^2}θ }}\)
⇒ 1

Question: In a circle with center O, a diameter AB is produced to a point P lying outside the circle and PT is a tangent to the circle at the point C on it. If ∠BPT = 36°, then what is the measure of ∠BCP?
Solution:
GIVEN:
PT is a tangent to the circle at the point C
∠BPT = 36°
CALCULATION:

In Δ OCP,
⇒ ∠OCP + ∠COP + ∠OPT = 180°
⇒ 90° + ∠COP + 36° = 180° (∵ OC is perpendicular to tangent PT)
⇒ ∠COP = 180° - 126° = 54°
In Δ OCB,
⇒ Let ∠OCB = ∠OBC = x° (∵ OC = OB = Radius)
⇒ ∠OCB + ∠OBC + ∠COB = 180°
⇒ x° + x° + 54° = 180°
⇒ 2x° = 126°
⇒ x° = 63°
⇒ ∠OCB = ∠OBC = x° = 63°
⇒ ∠OCP = ∠OCB + ∠BCP
⇒ 90° = 63° + ∠BCP
⇒ ∠BCP = 90° - 63° = 27°
∴ ∠BCP = 27°

Question: Surekha borrowed a sum of money and returned it in two equal annual installments of Rs. 5,547 each. If the rate of interest was \(7 \frac{1}{2}\%\) p.pa compounded yearly, then the total interest paid by her was:
Solution:
GIVEN:
two equal annual installments = Rs. 5,547 each, the rate of interest(R) was \(7 \frac{1}{2}\%\) p.pa compounded yearly
FORMULA USED:
P = [(Installment)/(1 + R/100)1 + (Installment)/(1+R/100)2]
CALCULATION:
P = [(Installment)/(1 + R/100)1 + (Installment)/(1+R/100)2]
⇒ P = [5547/(43/40)1 + 5547/(43/40)2]
⇒ P = 5547(40/43 + 1600/1849)
⇒ P = 5547(3320/1849)
⇒ P = Rs. 9960
⇒ Total Installment = 5547 × 2 = Rs. 11094
⇒ Total Interest = Rs(11094 - 9960)
⇒ Rs. 1134
∴ Total interest is Rs. 1134

Question: The graphs of the equations 3x - 20y - 2 = 0 and 11x - 5y + 61 = 0 intersect at P(a, b). What is the value of (a<sup>2</sup> + b<sup>2</sup> - ab)/(a<sup>2</sup> - b<sup>2</sup> + ab)?
Solution:
GIVEN:
3x - 20y - 2 = 0 and 11x - 5y + 61 = 0
CALCULATION:
3x - 20y - 2 = 0 ----(1)
⇒ (11x - 5y + 61 = 0) × 4 ----(2)
On subtracting these two equation
⇒ 41x = -246
⇒ x = - 6
putting the value of x = -6 in any of the two equation, we will get
⇒ y = -1
both the equations intersect each other at point P(a, b) = P(x. y)
⇒ a = -6 and b = -1
⇒ (a2 + b2 - ab)/(a2 - b2 + ab) = (36 + 1 - 6)/(36 - 1 + 6)
⇒ 31/41
∴ (a2 + b2 - ab)/(a2 - b2 + ab) = 31/41

Question: If (10a<sup>3</sup> + 4b<sup>3</sup>) : (11a<sup>3</sup> - 15b<sup>3</sup>) = 7 : 5, then (3a + 5b) : (9a - 2b) =?
Solution:
GIVEN:
(10a3 + 4b3) : (11a3 - 15b3) = 7 : 5
CALCULATION:
(10a3 + 4b3) : (11a3 - 15b3) = 7 : 5
⇒ 5 × (10a3 + 4b3) = 7 × (11a3 - 15b3)
⇒ 50a3 + 20b3 = 77a3 - 105b3
⇒ 27a3 = 125b3
⇒ 3a = 5b
⇒ a : b = 5 : 3
⇒ (3a + 5b) : (9a - 2b) =?
⇒ (3 × 5 + 5 × 3) : (9 × 5 - 2 × 3) = ?
⇒ 30 : 39 = ?
⇒ 10 : 13 = ?
∴ (3 × 5 + 5 × 3) : (9 × 5 - 2 × 3) = 10 : 13

Question: In ΔABC, ∠A - ∠B = 33°, ∠B - ∠C = 18° What is the sum of the smallest and the largest angles of the triangle?
Solution:
GIVEN:
∠A - ∠B = 33°, ∠B - ∠C = 18°
CALCULATION:
∠A - ∠B = 33°, ∠B - ∠C = 18°
⇒ ∠A = 33° + ∠B and ∠C = ∠B - 18°
⇒ ∠A + ∠B + ∠C = 180°
⇒ ∠B + 33° + ∠B + ∠B - 18° = 180°
⇒ 3∠B = 180° - 15°
⇒ 3∠B = 165°
⇒ ∠B = 55°
⇒ ∠A = 33° + 55° = 88°
⇒ ∠C = 55° - 18° = 37°
⇒ The largest angle A = 88° and the smallest angle C = 37°
⇒ Sum of the smallest and the largest angle = (88° + 37° ) = 125°
∴ Sum of the smallest and the largest angle is 125°

Alternate Method
∠A - ∠B = 33° ----(1)
∠B - ∠C = 18° ----(2)
Subtracting the two equations, we get
∠A - 2∠B + ∠C = 15°
∠A + ∠C = 2∠B + 15° ----(3)
In a triangle,
⇒ ∠A + ∠B + ∠C = 180°
Subtituting value of eqn (3)
3∠B = 180° - 15° = 165°
∠B = 55°
∠A = 55° + 33° = 88°
∠C = 55° - 18° = 37°
So, The sum of smalles and largest angle is 37° + 88° = 125°.

Question: Three men and 4 women can do a piece of work in 7 days, whereas 2 men and 1 woman can do it in 14 days. Seven women will complete the same work in:
Solution:
GIVEN:
3 men and 4 women can do a piece of work in 7 days and, 2 men and 1 woman can do it in 14 days
FORMULA USED:
M1D1 = M2D2, where M1and M2 = Number of person, D1 and D2 = Number of days
Total Work = Efficiency × Time
CALCULATION:
M1D1 = M2D
⇒ (3 men + 4 women) × 7 = (2 men + 1 women) × 14
⇒ (3 men + 4 women) = (2 men + 1 women) × 2
⇒ 3 men + 4 women = 4 men + 2 women
⇒ 2 women = men
⇒ (women ∶ men) = 1 : 2
⇒ Efficiency Ratio of (women ∶ men) = 1 ∶ 2
⇒ Total Work = Efficiency × Time
⇒ (3 men + 4 women) × 7 = (2 men + 1 women) × 14
⇒ (3 × 2 + 4 × 1) × 7 = (2 × 2 + 1 × 1) × 14 = 70
⇒ Total Work = 70
⇒ number of days to complete the work by 7 women = Total work/Efficiency
⇒ 70/(7 × 1)
⇒ 10 days
∴ Required number of days to complete the work by 7 women is 10 days
